items.name: Take Blip
items.stack: C# | .NET Core | Typescript | ReactJS | Azure | Docker | Kubernetes
items.description: I worked on the development of several REST APIs for integration with systems of clients like Nestlé, Vale, 99 Food, Petrobrás, among others. These APIs were intended to serve as a base for data consumption by Chatbots, and were developed mainly using C# and .NET Core, sometimes also using Node.JS and Express.JS. Also, I had to deal with the whole ecosystem that surrounded these APIs: Azure Devops, Docker, Docker Compose, Kubernetes, Seq Log.

items.name: Essencial Gestão Pública
items.stack: Typescript | ReactJS | Java | Spring Boot | MySql | Docker
items.description: I participated in the development of a Public Management System, being mainly responsible for refactoring a legacy front-end. The refactoring was done using Micro Frontends pattern, along with React.JS and its entire ecosystem. In addition, I brought to the backend of the project (Java, Spring Boot) practices of using technologies such as: Docker, Docker Compose, Log4J, Graylog. This experience not only helped me to grow technically but also helped me to improve my management skills, since for the refactoring of this front-end I counted with the help of two interns that were in the process of learning.

items.name: Freelancer
items.description: In 2020 I worked for a local company developing a desktop software for internal process management, it was my first paid job as a developer. The technologies used were: Node.JS, Express.JS, Electron.JS, Firebase.

items.name: Mackenzie US
items.description: Perhaps the most impactful parts of the course for me were those where I learned basic things that formed and reinforced my basic knowledge in technology, I am grateful to subjects such as Calculation, Hardware, Algorithms, Data Structure, Ethics, among others.
